medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing episodes of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was asymptomatic on a low-fat diet until six days ago when episodes of RUQ pain and emesis began again. These symptoms resolved between episodes. Persistent nausea and emesis started three days ago, leading her to contact Dr. ___. After being advised to continue on a clear liquid diet, she tolerated it well for two days without pain or nausea. However, after eating a cracker this morning, she developed pain with an episode of emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Chiari malformation, Type I; Past surgical history includes neurosurgery for Type I Chiari malformation, ureteral reimplantation, and tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Coronary artery disease (CAD) in paternal grandfather; cervical cancer in mother; cancer in maternal grandmother.
